entry.title: Young Girls (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Amrita Sher-Gil's Young Girls (pictured) earned her the Paris Salon's gold medal in 1933, making her the first Asian to be awarded the prize?

entry.title: Wee Toon Boon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Wee Toon Boon remained a member of the Parliament of Singapore even after he began serving a prison sentence for corruption?

entry.title: Saskatchewan Conservation House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Saskatchewan Conservation House, built in 1977 to withstand Canadian winter temperatures, did not use a furnace?

entry.title: Adila Laïdi-Hanieh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Adila Laïdi-Hanieh and her team used digitisation to preserve endangered Palestinian material culture?

entry.title: one metropolis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite being 80 miles (130 km) apart, Austin and San Antonio are merging into one metropolis?

entry.title: Şenay Duzcu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that comedian Şenay Duzcu was awarded the German–Turkish Friendship Prize?

entry.title: Leonia Alternative High School (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Leonia Alternative High School's employment of volunteer instructors led to opposition from the local teachers' union?

entry.title: Louis Zhang Jiashu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Louis Zhang Jiashu, a Catholic bishop of Shanghai who studied at Canterbury in 1911, received the archbishop of Canterbury, Michael Ramsey, in Shanghai in 1983?
